author: Alyssa Chutka
title: 3 Colorado Skincare Brands That Will Fix Your Dry Winter Skin - 5280
text: The Local newsletter is your free, daily guide to life in Colorado. For locals, by locals. Sign up today! The Centennial State‚Äôs cold, dry winters are notorious for wringing the moisture out of your epidermis‚Äîwhich helps explain why these locals have gone to such lengths to find ways to keep Coloradans‚Äô skin supple all year long. [BlackTravelBox](https://theblacktravelbox.com/) On a trip to Japan, Denverite Orion Brown was unable to find humidity-fighting products that would prevent her natural curls from turning into a frizzy mess. So Brown set out to create products specifically designed for Black voyagers, who are often shut out from the travel-size section. But Brown‚Äôs favorite offering works just as well at home in Colorado: The [Body Balm](https://theblacktravelbox.com/collections/all-products/products/shea-butter-body-balm), a creamy body butter, is made with mango to help restore skin elasticity. And though competitors‚Äô lotions can be around 60 to 80 percent water, Brown‚Äôs highly concentrated products contain no added H2O: A two-ounce jar of her salve will last you as long as an eight-ounce container of mass-market gunk, making BlackTravelBox the perfect option for travelers who want a little to go a long way. Body Balm, $8 [Freedom Creators Co](https://freedomcreatorsco.com/) Talisa Caldwell suffered from eczema and allergies her whole life, but the over-the-counter lotions she bought made her breakouts worse, while prescription medication proved to be a temporary remedy. That drove her to found Colorado Springs‚Äìbased Freedom Creators Co, which only uses ingredients that won‚Äôt irritate your already aching skin. Caldwell‚Äôs hottest-selling ointment is the [Skin Balm](https://freedomcreatorsco.com/collections/skin-balms), a moisturizer made with grapeseed oil, which can reduce pain and swelling from eczema, and coconut oil, a natural anti-inflammatory that can help treat acne. Not only does Freedom make your skin feel good, but with Caldwell donating 10 percent of each purchase to a Ugandan orphanage, your conscience is sure to shine, too. Skin Balm, $25 [Colorado Aromatics](https://coloradoaromatics.com/) Biochemist Cindy Jones grows more than 30 herbs on her Longmont farm, each with its own specific skin-salving purpose. [Knuckle Balm](https://coloradoaromatics.com/products/knuckle-balm), intended for those with especially beat-up mitts, is made of calendula to promote healing and plantain to help soothe aggravated skin. Colorado Aromatics‚Äô products aren‚Äôt only crafted from natural ingredients; the company has also previously enlisted conservation biologists to survey Jones‚Äô farm and strategize ways to reduce environmental impacts, manage invasive pests, and support the wild animals that frequently roam its rows. Knuckle Balm, $16

Un uomo ha ucciso a colpi di pistola il compagno della ex moglie a Marano di Napoli per poi togliersi la vita. L'assassino avrebbe inseguito la vittima con il suo scooter e l'avrebbe raggiunta mentre si trovava a bordo di un'auto, non lontano da una scuola. Qui, dopo diversi tentativi di avvicinamento, avrebbe giustiziato l'uomo con diversi colpi di pistola. Poi si sarebbe tolto la vita. La vittima dell'omicidio aveva gi√† denunciato in passato alle forze dell'ordine di aver subito minacce di morte da parte del suo assassino. üîó

author: VNExplorer
title: Breaking: Gallant Super Eagles slay Elephant of Cote d'Ivoire
text:
By Kazeem Ugbodaga
The Super Eagles of Nigeria have defeated the Elephant of Cote d‚ÄôIvoire 1-o to brighten their chances of qualifying for AFCON knockout stage.
William Troost-Ekong converted a penalty in the 55th minute of the game to give the Eagles the much needed win.
Troost-Ekong won the battle of wills and sent an unstoppable penalty past Yahia Fofana into middle of the goal.
Earlier in the eighth minute, Victor Osimhen made a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and took a shot that went just over the crossbar.
A minute later, Christian Kouame had a great chance inside the six-yard box, shot to the middle of the goal, but Stanley Nwabili pulled off an exquisite save to deny him.
In the 31st minute, Seko Fofana wasted an opportunity. He found himself in acres of space and fired in a terrific shot from long range straight towards the right side of the target, but the goalkeeper made a brilliant save.
In the 62nd minute, Osimhen wasted a chance to score. He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the right post.
In the 73rd minute, Seko Fofana received a precise pass on the edge of the box and released a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flew painfully close to the right post.
Provided by SyndiGate Media Inc. (Syndigate.info).

author: Edward Barnes
title: Plans go in for new Merseyside school that will cost nearly ¬£60m
text:
Work is expected to start later this year Plans go in for new Merseyside school that will cost nearly ¬£60m
The new Mosslands School will be a major change for the area (Image: Ellis Williams Architects Limited )
Plans have gone in for a new Merseyside school, with work expected to start later this year if the go ahead is given.
The Mosslands School in Wirral was one of two in Wirral earmarked to be rebuilt in 2022 with funding paid for by the Department for Education (DfE.) The current cost of the project is expected to be just under ¬£58m and will see an entire redevelopment of the school site.
‚Äå
The new school will be built to the south of the existing school site which will enable Mosslands to continue operating in its current buildings while works take place. Parts of the school were first built in 1952 but are now past their expiry date leading to problems such as leaking roofs and a whole host of other issues.
‚Äå
With the redevelopment will come a brand new three-storey school building, a new theatre, two sports halls and fitness suite, a junior pitch, netball courts, a full size county level pitch, and an under 12s pitch alongside an engineering centre and facilities for children with complex needs. Better insulated‚Ä¶
Edward Barnes
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->construction and property

author: Redacci√≥n ILE√ìN
title: Aprobados cinco marcoparques solares que ocupan m√°s de 500 hect√°reas en la comarca leonesa de la Valduerna
text:
La Junta de Castilla y Le√≥n ha aprobado en un mismo golpe la autorizaci√≥n de construcci√≥n de cinco macroparques solares que se instalar√°n en la comarca de la Valduerna, seg√∫n ha publicado el Bolet√≠n Oficial de la Provincia (BOP) este viernes 5 de julio. Todos ellos ocupar√°n m√°s de 500 hect√°reas de siete municipios. Se trata de un conjunto de ocho parques solares proyectados en la comarca de la Valduerna. Todos los proyectos tienen una potencia m√°xima instalada en el entorno de los 49MW, por debajo del l√≠mite de 50 que obligar√≠a a que la autorizaci√≥n fuera del Ministerio de Transici√≥n Ecol√≥gica y no de la Junta de Castilla y Le√≥n, que tomar√° la decisi√≥n de su autorizaci√≥n. Todos ellos atribuidos al grupo Erbienerg√≠a, vinculado a la familia de empresarios mineros Lamelas Viloria.
Tan solo uno de estos parques, 'Castillo III', fue tumbado en agosto del a√±o pasado por estar proyectado en los terrenos quemados por el incendio de Castrocontrigo.
El primero de ellos es 'Castrillo I', ubicado en Castrillo de la Valduerna y Destriana, en cuyo proyecto original se reflejaba que ocupar√≠an 103 hect√°reas con m√°s de 75.000 m√≥dulos solares. Tambi√©n en Destriana, Castrillo de la Valduerna, Villamont√°n y Quintana y Congosto se construir√° el macroparque solar 'Valduerna IV', de 167 hect√°reas proyectadas.
El tercero de los proyectos es 'Antracita', que se proyecta en Villagat√≥n y Quintana del Castillo con 81,6 hect√°reas en el proyecto original. Le sigue el proyecto 'Hulla', de 80,7 hect√°reas en Villagat√≥n y Quintana del Castillo, y el quinto: 'Villameca', con 82,2 hect√°reas proyectadas √∫nicamente en Villagat√≥n.
Los proyectos ya se han encontrado con la oposici√≥n de la Plataforma Alta Valduerna, que recientemente ha enviado un escrito a la presidenta de la Comisi√≥n de Peticiones del Parlamento Europeo, Dolors Montserrat, que ha pedido que el Parlamento Europeo lleve a cabo una investigaci√≥n sobre la falta de evaluaci√≥n ambiental y la saturaci√≥n de proyectos de energ√≠as renovables.

author: Press Trust of India
title: On Minister's Orders, 2 Teachers Suspended In Kota For 'Love Jihad', 'Conversion'
text: Minister Madan Dilawar said the teachers could also be dismissed from service. Two government school teachers were suspended and an inquiry was initiated against a third for their alleged involvement in religious conversion, "love jihad" and ties to banned "jihadi outfits", Rajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar said. Mr Dilawar, in a video statement issued on Friday, said strict action has been initiated against three teachers in a government senior secondary school at Khajuri Odpur village in Sangod. According to an order by the education officer, the minister ordered action against the teachers after a local group, Sarv Hindu Samaj, Sangod, gave him a memorandum on the matter. The minister said that it was brought to his notice that the name of a Hindu girl studying in the school was noted down as "Islam" on her transfer certificate. "There is a conspiracy of religious conversion and love jihad and Hindu girls are being forced to read namaz... this was brought to my notice," Mr Dilawar said in the video. The minister said he has ordered the suspension of two teachers, Firoj Khan and Mirza Mujahid, and action against the third teacher, Shabana, is underway. Mr Dilawar also said the teachers could also be dismissed from service based on further investigation. The memorandum also claimed that one Hindu girl who was named as Muslim in the school record was abducted by Muslim youths and was yet to be traced. An order directing action against the teachers was issued by the Kota district education officer (secondary) on Thursday following directions from the education minister. According to the order, the minister was handed over a memorandum by Sarv Hindu Samaj, Sangod, during his visit to the area on Tuesday alleging that some teachers were involved in "love jihad", religious conversion and ties to banned "jihadi outfits". 'Love jihad' is a term often used by the right wing to allege a ploy by Muslim men to lure Hindu women into religious conversion through marriage. Promoted Listen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com All three teachers have been ordered to report to the directorate of education, Bikaner during this period, as per the order. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
